p.s: Description of Mycobacterium timonense sp. nov.
Mycobacterium timonense (ti.mo.nen′se. N.L. neut. adj. timonense pertaining to La Timone, the name of a hospital in Marseille, France, where the first strains were isolated).
Cells are acid-fast, Gram-positive bacilli with a mean size of 0.9×0.45 μm.
Unpigmented colonies grow on 5 % sheep blood agar, Middlebrook 7H10 agar and egg-based Löwenstein–Jensen slants after 10 days incubation at 30 °C.
It shares 96.3–99.6 % 16S rRNA gene, 96.3–99.6 % rpoB, 91.0–98.2 % hsp65 and 38.3–90.6 % ITS-1 sequence similarities with MAC reference strains.
The type strain is 5351974T (=CIP 109830T =CCUG 56329T =CSUR P32T), sequevar MAC-K, which was recovered from sputum.
Strain 3256799 (=CCUG 56328 =CIP 109829 =CSUR P33), sequevar MAC-L, is a reference strain.
